page.title: 04FARMING AROUND BAUMBER.
page.content: The main crops in this area are wheat, barley, sugar beat, oil seed rape, and grass for hay.Other small crops are peas and potatoes. Some farmers intend to introduce lupins shortly. Although this is only an arable area, farmers keep cattle also. Popular breeds are Lincoln Reds, Hereford x Cherolais, Fresians used for beef rather than milk. Many farmers keep sheep such as Suffolk cross by texal, Scottish Halfbreeds, and mules. They are bred for slaughter not for wool. They are slaughtered from 4 months to 1 year old. In recent years machinery has become bigger and easier to use. A farmer will own or share combine harvesters, tractors, drills, fork lift, trucks and corn dryers and cultivation instuments. More chemicals and fertilizers are used. Fields are bigger with more drainage.
